briefdescription.para: Initializes a data slot allocator object, used to assign integer IDs for data slots.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusDataSlotAllocator *allocator, DBusDataSlotList *list, int slot, void *data, DBusFreeFunction free_data_func, DBusFreeFunction *old_free_func, void **old_data)
memberdef.name: _dbus_data_slot_list_set

briefdescription.para: Stores a pointer in the data slot list, along with an optional function to be used for freeing the data when the data is set again, or when the slot list is finalized.

detaileddescription.para: The slot number must have been allocated with _dbus_data_slot_allocator_alloc() for the same allocator passed in here. The same allocator has to be used with the slot list every time.

parameterdescription.para: free function for any previously-existing data
previously-existing data, should be freed with old_free_func

simplesect.para: TRUE if there was enough memory to store the data

detaileddescription.para: The slot must still be allocated (must not have been freed).

parameterdescription.para: the allocator slot was allocated from
the slot to get data from

simplesect.para: the data, or NULL if not found

briefdescription.para: Frees all data slots contained in the list, calling application-provided free functions if they exist.
Frees the data slot list and all data slots contained in it, calling application-provided free functions if they exist.

ref.tooltip: Macro used prior to declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
DBusDataSlot is used to store application data on the connection.
An allocated slot for storing data.
An allocator that tracks a set of slot IDs.
Data structure that stores the actual user data set at a given slot.
Macro used after declaring functions in the D-Bus header files.
